io.oasp.module.logging.common.impl

Class SecureLoggingLogbackTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.core.api.Assertions
      • io.oasp.module.test.common.base.BaseTest
        • io.oasp.module.test.common.base.ModuleTest
          • io.oasp.module.logging.common.impl.SecureLoggingLogbackTest

  • public class SecureLoggingLogbackTest
extends io.oasp.module.test.common.base.ModuleTest
    Test class for SecureLogging, when used with logback.
    Tests Marker initialization, logging of events with and without Markers, masking and filtering.

    Main functionality is adapted from test classes of OWASP:
    owasp-security-logging-logback/src/test/java/org/owasp/security/logging/mask/MaskingConverterTest and ../filter/ExcludeClassifiedMarkerFilterTest

      • testDefaultLogEvent

        public void testDefaultLogEvent()
        Test if logging works at all, without using any Markers.

      • testLogEventWithMarker

        public void testLogEventWithMarker()
        Test the output of a log event with a marker.

      • testLogEventWithMasking

        public void testLogEventWithMasking()
        Test the output of a log event with a classification Marker and an argument that shall be masked. Note: the console will show the 'password' content when running this test.

      • testExclClassifMarkerFilter

        public void testExclClassifMarkerFilter()
        Test the ExcludeClassifiedMarkerFilter on an event with MultiMarker (other tests are done within OWASP).

      • testInitMarkersByName

        public void testInitMarkersByName()
        Test if a combined Marker contains the names of its constituent Markers. This test is useful in particular if the dependency org.owasp is not available, but also works when it is present. To test the fall back solution in SecureLogging, one has to create a separate logging module strictly without the OWASP dependency.

      • testInitWithMultiMarkerClass

        public void testInitWithMultiMarkerClass()
        Test Marker creation if the dependency org.owasp is available, which provides the class MultiMarker.
